column5: 6e}}</ref><ref name=LR/> (or '''''tyelpë'''''<ref name=Shibb/>), '''''tyelep-'''''<ref name=UT6e/>, and '''''telep'''''<ref name=SApp/>, are [[Quenya]] words for "[[silver]]".

column2: Tolkien]] stated that the form ''tyelpe'' derives from [[Primitive Elvish]] ''[[kyelepē]]''.<ref name=L347/>

column1: It appears like ''tyelpe'' is the most ancient (or "pure") Quenya word for silver; the  form ''telpe'', which became the usual form among the Quenya-speaking [[Elves]], was borrowed from (or influenced by) [[Telerin]] ''[[telepi
column2: telpe]]'' (itself apparently a later form of the original Telerin form ''[[telepi]]'').<ref name=L347/><ref name=UT6e/><ref name=Shibb>{{PM

column1: [[Christopher Tolkien]] has noted that ''tyelep-'', ''tyelpe'' derive from [[Sundocarme
